name: 2010 Iron Pearl Kennel Sponsor
description:
In order for our team to race the Iditarod, they must have support from an entire kennel. By sponsoring our kennel you’ll be helping us with things like sled and ATV repairs, veterinary bills, puppy and yearling food, improvements, vaccinations and more.

Sponsorship Benefits:
• Top Listing and Link on Website
• Logo on all Email Communications
• Logo on IPK Dog Truck
• Logo on Fundraising T-shirt Sleeve
	

• Recognition at Musher’s Banquet
• Patch on Musher’s Coat and Sled
• Signed Photo of Thomas Lesatz
• Signed IPK T-shirt

By sponsoring the Kennel, you’ll also receive the opportunity to come visit the kennel, see what it’s like to be a part of an Iditarod racing kennel and go on a dog sled ride with Tom or Jessica. (Please note: Travel to and from kennel is not included.)

name: 2010 Race Sponsor
description:
Throughout the year, Tom and Jessica will be participating in a couple of different shorter distance races. They include everything from a small local race to the Copper Basin 300.

The main focus of our racing season is the Iditarod in March. However, we participate in shorter distance races throughout the winter season. This insures that the dogs gain experience, in addition to their training. Just like any other sport, the more practice that you get the better you’re do.

Racing is super expensive but critical to our kennels success. The cost of doing a race includes everything from an entry fee and supplies for the race itself to transportation, pre- and post- race accommodations, meals and more.

Sponsorship Benefits:
• Second Listing and Link on Website
• Logo on all Email Communications
• Logo on IPK Dog Truck
• Logo on Fundraising T-shirt Back
• Recognition at Musher’s Banquet
• IPK T-shirt

name: 2010 Sponsor a Checkpoint
description:
Throughout the Iditarod, Tom will visit 20 different check points. If you choose this sponsorship, you’ll be supplying him with the critical things he’ll need during the race. This will ensure that he’ll have enough dog food, supplies, clothes, personal gear, sled supplies and more. After the race, you’ll receive a bag from the checkpoint you sponsored signed by Tom. See a list of the check points available and get on the trail!

Sponsorship Benefits:
• Listing and Link on Website
• Logo on all Email Communications
• Recognition at Musher’s Banquet
• Logo on Fundraising T-shirt Back
• Bag from Iditarod Checkpoint signed by Tom

name: 2010 Sponsor a Dog
description:
Provide a dog with everything they’ll need for an entire racing season. This sponsorship will include everything from food, supplies, equipment, vet care and more for the dog you choose to sponsor. Meet the Dogs and sponsor one today!

• Listing and Link on Website
• Name on all Email Communications
• Logo on Fundraising T-shirt Back
• Dog Picture and Stat Sheet

name: 2011 Pack the Sled
description: For any amount, you can help us pack the sled with the necessary gear. Having the right supplies is essential to the success of any good dog team. The list of supplies needed is pretty extensive. It includes things like fleece gloves, batteries for head lamps, dog “booties”, sled runners, dog blankets, harnesses, parkas, boots and more. Any amount you can contribute will be greatly appreciated and put to great use.
